q: Why is my dog chewing furniture?
a: Dogs chew due to boredom, teething, stress or excess energy. Redirect with chew toys and increase daily walks. Our dog toys collection helps!

q: Why is my cat vomiting hairballs?
a: Cats groom frequently. Use hairball-control food, brush regularly, and ensure proper hydration. We have great grooming brushes in stock.

q: How often should I bathe my dog?
a: Most dogs need bathing every 4-12 weeks, depending on coat type and activity. Use gentle pet shampoo to protect their skin.

q: What should I feed my puppy?
a: Puppies need high-protein food formulated for growth. Feed 3-4 times daily until 6 months old. Consult your vet for portion sizes.

q: How much exercise does my dog need?
a: Adult dogs need 30-60 minutes daily. Puppies need shorter, frequent sessions. High-energy breeds need more. Our toys help keep them active!

q: Why is my cat not eating?
a: Loss of appetite can indicate illness, stress, or food issues. Try fresh food, change location, or consult a vet immediately.

q: How do I stop my dog from barking?
a: Identify triggers: boredom, anxiety, or alerting. Increase exercise, use positive reinforcement, and consider training. Calm toys help.

q: Can cats eat dog food?
a: No. Cats need taurine and other nutrients dogs don't. Use cat-specific food to keep them healthy.

q: How often should I trim my cat's nails?
a: Every 2-4 weeks, depending on growth. Use cat nail clippers or a grinder. Keep scratching posts available.

q: Why does my dog have dry skin?
a: Dry skin can result from allergies, diet, or low humidity. Use moisturizing shampoo, add omega-3s, and increase water intake.

q: How do I introduce a new pet?
a: Go slow! Keep separated initially, let them smell each other under doors, then supervised meetings. Use treats and positive reinforcement.

q: What toys are safe for dogs?
a: Choose durable, size-appropriate toys. Avoid small choking hazards. Our safety-tested toys are perfect for all breeds.

q: Why is my cat aggressive?
a: Aggression comes from fear, pain, or territorial behavior. Redirect with toys, reduce triggers, and consult a behaviorist if severe.

q: How many meals per day for adult dogs?
a: Most adult dogs thrive on 1-2 meals daily. Smaller breeds may need 2-3. Consistency helps with digestion and training.

q: Can I give my dog treats?
a: Yes, treats are great for training! Keep them to 10% of daily calories. Our natural treats are healthy and delicious.

q: Why does my dog pull on the leash?
a: Dogs pull from excitement or habit. Use positive reinforcement, harnesses that discourage pulling, and consistent training.

q: How do I know if my pet is overweight?
a: You should feel ribs easily without pressing. Check with your vet for ideal weight. Regular exercise and portion control help.

q: What's the best bedding for cats?
a: Soft, washable beds in quiet spots work best. Some cats love enclosed beds for security. Provide multiple options.

q: How do I prevent fleas and ticks?
a: Use vet-approved preventatives monthly. Check pets regularly, keep bedding clean, and groom frequently. Prevention is key!

q: Why won't my cat use the litter box?
a: Check box cleanliness, location, and size. Medical issues, stress, or preference changes cause avoidance. Consult a vet.

q: How often should I brush my dog?
a: Short-haired: weekly. Long-haired: 2-3x weekly. Brushing reduces shedding and mats. Our grooming tools make it easy!

q: Can dogs eat chocolate?
a: No! Chocolate is toxic to dogs. Even small amounts can cause serious harm. Keep all chocolate away safely.

q: What's a good diet for senior dogs?
a: Senior dogs need fewer calories, more fiber, and joint support. Look for glucosamine and soft food. Smaller, frequent meals help.

q: Why does my cat knock things off tables?
a: Cats do this for play, attention, or to check surfaces. Provide interactive toys and ignore the behavior to discourage it.

q: How do I crate train my dog?
a: Make the crate positive! Use treats, toys, and short sessions. Never force. Crates help with housebreaking and safety.

q: What health checks do puppies need?
a: Vet visits every 3-4 weeks until 16 weeks, vaccines, deworming, and socialization. Early care is crucial for healthy development.

q: Why is my cat meowing excessively?
a: Cats meow for attention, hunger, heat, or medical issues. Check medical status first, then reduce triggers or seek vet advice.

q: How do I stop my dog from jumping?
a: Ignore jumping, reward calm behavior, teach 'sit,' and manage excitement with exercise. Consistency is key!

q: Can cats be trained?
a: Yes! Cats respond to clicker training and treats. They're independent but learn commands, tricks, and good habits.

q: What's the right collar and leash?
a: Choose size-appropriate, comfortable options. Martingale collars prevent escape. Harnesses distribute pressure better. We have all types!

q: Why does my dog scratch a lot?
a: Scratching indicates allergies, parasites, or skin conditions. Check for fleas, try diet changes, or see your vet for relief.

q: How do I introduce cats and dogs?
a: Gradual introductions are best. Let them smell each other first, then supervise interactions. Use treats to build positive associations.

q: What bedding do dogs prefer?
a: Orthopedic beds comfort older dogs. Cooling beds help in summer. Washable, durable fabrics work best.

q: Why is my cat hiding?
a: Cats hide when stressed, ill, or scared. Provide safe spaces and check for medical issues. Give them time to adjust.

q: How much water should my dog drink?
a: About 0.5-1 ounce per pound daily. Monitor intake; excessive drinking signals illness. Keep fresh water available always.

q: Can I leave my dog home alone?
a: Adult dogs: 4-8 hours safely. Puppies: 1-2 hours per month of age. Provide toys, pads, and gradual training for separation anxiety.

q: What toys do cats prefer?
a: Interactive toys, balls, feather wands, and puzzle feeders entertain cats. Rotate toys to maintain interest. Play 10-15 minutes daily.

q: How do I stop my dog from digging?
a: Digging is natural! Provide a sandbox, bury toys, increase exercise, and supervise. Redirect instead of punishing.

q: Why does my cat spray?
a: Spraying marks territory, shows stress, or indicates heat. Spay/neuter, reduce triggers, and use enzymatic cleaners.

q: What's a good first dog breed?
a: Consider size, energy, and temperament. Labs, Golden Retrievers, and Beagles are popular. Research breeds matching your lifestyle!

q: How do I clip my dog's nails?
a: Use dog nail clippers, trim at 45 degrees before the quick. If unsure, have a groomer do it. Our grooming tools make it easier!

q: Can cats have catnip?
a: Yes! Catnip is safe for most cats (some are unresponsive). Offer occasionally; it provides enrichment and play stimulation.

q: Why does my dog eat grass?
a: Dogs eat grass from boredom, digestion help, or nutrient needs. It's usually harmless but check diet quality.

q: What's the best way to train a dog?
a: Use positive reinforcement, consistency, patience, and short sessions. Reward good behavior. Consider professional training for complex issues.

q: How do I know if my cat is sick?
a: Watch for: lethargy, vomiting, diarrhea, appetite loss, or litter box changes. Contact your vet immediately if concerned.

q: What's a good exercise routine for puppies?
a: Play sessions, 5 minutes per month of age twice daily. Avoid hard exercise on joints. Gradually increase as they grow.

q: Can I bathe my cat?
a: Most cats dislike baths. Use lukewarm water, hold gently, and work quickly. Some cats tolerate waterless shampoo better.

q: Why does my dog follow me everywhere?
a: Dogs are pack animals and see you as their leader. It's normal bonding. Provide reassurance and maintain training consistency.

q: How do I choose the right pet food?
a: Check ingredients, nutritional balance, and consult your vet. Quality brands avoid fillers and artificial additives. Your vet can recommend!

q: Why is my cat's litter box smelly?
a: Clean the box daily! Use clumping litter, change completely weekly. Box size affects odor too. Proper maintenance is key.

q: What's good preventive care for dogs?
a: Annual vet visits, vaccinations, parasite prevention, dental care, and healthy diet. Early prevention saves money and health issues!

q: Can dogs eat fruits and vegetables?
a: Yes! Safe options: apples, carrots, sweet potatoes, blueberries. Avoid grapes, onions, and avocados. Serve as treats in moderation.

q: How do I help my dog with separation anxiety?
a: Gradual training, leaving items with your scent, puzzle toys, and sometimes anxiety medication. Start with short absences.

q: What grooming tools do I need for my dog?
a: Brush (type depends on coat), nail clippers, dog shampoo, and possibly a slicker for matted hair. We have complete grooming kits!

q: Why does my cat have a dry nose?
a: Cats noses naturally vary in moisture. Concern if also sick or avoiding water. Ensure proper hydration and contact vet if concerned.

q: How do I teach my dog to sit?
a: Hold a treat above their nose, slowly move back. Their rear naturally goes down. Say 'sit' and reward. Repeat daily for quick learning!

q: What's the best age to spay/neuter?
a: Generally 6 months or after first heat for females. Discuss timing with your vet. It prevents diseases and unwanted behavior.

q: Can cats eat human food?
a: Limited safe foods: cooked chicken, turkey, fish. Avoid: onions, garlic, chocolate, grapes. Stick to cat food for complete nutrition.

q: How often should I play with my dog?
a: At least once daily for 30-60 minutes depending on age and energy. Multiple short sessions work great. Play builds bonds!

q: Why is my cat's breath bad?
a: Dental disease causes odor. Brush teeth regularly, provide dental treats, and see your vet. Clean teeth mean better health!

q: What should I do if my dog eats something toxic?
a: Contact your vet or poison control immediately. Bring the packaging. Time is critical. Keep pet monitoring info handy!

q: How do I make my home cat-proof?
a: Secure breakables, cover wires, block high ledges, use cat-proof trash cans, and remove toxic plants. Safety first!

q: Why won't my dog come when called?
a: Use high-value treats, practice in safe areas, reward immediately, and make it fun. Never chase or punish. Build positive associations!

q: What are signs my cat is in pain?
a: Changes in behavior, reduced appetite, limping, excessive grooming, or excessive vocalization. Vet visit is essential for diagnosis.

q: How do I introduce my dog to other dogs?
a: Neutral location, keep leashes loose, watch body language, and separate if tension builds. Parallel walking works great initially!

q: What's the best litter type?
a: Clumping litter is convenient and odor-controlling. Some cats prefer non-clumping. Test to find what your cat prefers!

q: Why does my dog have bad breath?
a: Dental disease, diet, or medical issues cause it. Brush teeth daily, use dental chews, and see your vet for cleaning.

q: Can I use human grooming products on my pet?
a: No! Human products harm pets' skin pH and coat. Use pet-specific shampoo and conditioners. Our grooming products are vet-approved!

q: How do I help my dog with car sickness?
a: Start with short rides, keep car cool, avoid food before travel, use calming aids, and consider medication. Gradual exposure helps.

q: Why does my cat over-groom?
a: Stress, allergies, or skin issues cause over-grooming. Reduce stressors, check for parasites, and see your vet if persistent.

q: What age can puppies socialize with other dogs?
a: After 3-4 weeks of vaccines (usually 12-16 weeks). Supervised, safe socialization builds confidence and prevents aggression.

q: How often should I change my cat's litter?
a: Scoop daily, change completely weekly. More frequent changes reduce odor and keep cats comfortable. Regular maintenance matters!

q: Why does my dog pull when excited?
a: Excitement builds energy. Use a no-pull harness, teach heel command, and calm environment training. Consistent, patient training works!

q: What temperature is safe for my pet outside?
a: Dogs: avoid above 80°F, below 45°F for extended periods. Cats: similar. Monitor paw pads and panting. Cold? Use sweaters!

q: How do I teach my cat to use the toilet?
a: Training kits available but time-intensive. Most cats adapt to litter boxes better. Litter box use is natural for them.

q: Why does my dog have itchy paws?
a: Allergies, yeast, or parasites cause itching. Check between pads, use paw soaks, and see your vet for diagnosis and treatment.

q: Can cats eat raw food?
a: Raw diets carry contamination risks. Cooked meat is safer. Discuss nutrition with your vet before changing diets.

q: How do I introduce a kitten to an adult cat?
a: Separate initially, let them smell under doors, then supervised meetings. Use treats to build positive associations. Patience pays off!

q: What's the best way to trim a cat's claws?
a: Use cat clippers, trim transparent part only, avoid the pink quick. Keep sessions short and reward with treats!

q: Why is my dog restless at night?
a: Excess energy, discomfort, or anxiety cause restlessness. Increase daytime exercise, create a cozy bed, and establish routines.

q: How do I bathe a dog that hates water?
a: Use lukewarm water, move slowly, start from feet, and use gentle voice. High-value treats help. Dry immediately to prevent chilling.

q: What's normal cat shedding?
a: Most cats shed year-round. Spring/summer increases shedding. Brush regularly to manage loose hair and reduce matting.

q: How do I know if my dog has worms?
a: Look for scooting, visible worms in stool, vomiting, or weight loss. Your vet can confirm with a stool sample and prescribe medication.

q: Why does my cat have dilated pupils?
a: Normal in low light. Persistent dilation indicates stress, pain, or medical issues. Contact your vet if prolonged or paired with other symptoms.

q: What's a good starting point for dog training?
a: Basic commands: sit, stay, down, come. Use positive reinforcement. Short 5-10 minute sessions work best. Consistency matters most!

q: How do I reduce my dog's anxiety?
a: Exercise regularly, create safe spaces, use calming toys, establish routines, and consider anxiety supplements. Vet consultation helps!

q: Can cats learn tricks?
a: Yes! Clicker training works great. Cats learn: high-five, sit, come, and more. Use treats and keep sessions fun and short!

q: Why is my dog scared of thunderstorms?
a: Fear is common. Create a safe, quiet space, use calming aids, maintain normal behavior, and consider desensitization training.

q: What's a healthy weight for my cat?
a: Depends on breed and size. You should feel ribs easily. Discuss with your vet. Obesity causes serious health problems.

q: How do I stop my dog from resource guarding?
a: Never force items away. Trade for high-value treats. Consult a trainer for severe guarding. Early intervention prevents aggression.

q: Why does my cat rub against me?
a: Your cat is marking you as theirs! It's affection and scent communication. Rubbing also calms them. Treasure it!

q: What's proper leash etiquette on walks?
a: Keep leash loose, walk beside your dog, maintain consistent pace, and let them sniff naturally. This builds walking skills!

q: How do I help my dog with allergies?
a: Identify triggers: food, environmental, or seasonal. Work with your vet for elimination diets, medication, or hyposensitization therapy.

q: Can cats eat dairy?
a: Most adult cats are lactose intolerant. Small amounts of plain yogurt okay, but avoid milk and cheese. Water is the best drink!

q: How often should I take my dog to the vet?
a: Puppies: every 3-4 weeks until 16 weeks, then annually. Adults: annually. Seniors (7+): twice yearly for early disease detection.

q: Why is my cat's tail puffed up?
a: Fear or excitement! A puffed tail indicates stress or playfulness. Watch other body language. Provide a safe space if scared.

q: What's the best way to teach 'stay'?
a: Start close, hold 2 seconds, reward. Gradually increase distance and duration. Use hand signal consistently. Practice daily!

q: How do I choose appropriate toys for my puppy?
a: Size-appropriate, durable, and safe. Rotate toys to maintain interest. Avoid small choking hazards. Supervision during play is essential!

q: Why is my cat not grooming herself?
a: Laziness, stress, pain, or illness cause poor grooming. Check medical status. Brush them gently to maintain their coat.

q: What's the best bedding for a dog crate?
a: Soft, washable pads that fit the crate. Some dogs prefer blankets. Keep it clean and dry. Ensure comfort for positive crate association!

q: How do I manage my cat's indoor boredom?
a: Provide interactive toys, puzzle feeders, window perches, scratching posts, and climbing structures. Enrichment prevents destructive behavior!

q: Why does my dog have ear infections?
a: Moisture, allergies, or parasites cause infections. Check ears weekly, keep them dry, and use preventative drops. Vet care if persistent!

q: Can cats watch TV?
a: Some cats enjoy it, especially bird/nature videos! It's harmless and provides mental stimulation. Rotate content to maintain interest!

q: What should I know about pet insurance?
a: Coverage varies: accidents, illness, preventive care, wellness. Compare plans, understand deductibles, and get coverage early for better rates.

q: How do I introduce new family members to my dog?
a: Let dog adjust gradually. Supervise with children. Establish rules: no jumping on babies, respecting boundaries. Build positive associations together!

q: Why does my cat hiss?
a: Hissing is a defensive warning. Your cat feels threatened. Respect their space, move slowly, and provide a safe area.

q: What's the right harness for my dog?
a: Back-clip harnesses prevent pulling. Front-clip gives more control. Measure correctly for comfort. Our selection fits all sizes!

q: How do I stop my dog from counter surfing?
a: Remove temptation, supervise closely, teach 'leave it,' and reward for staying on ground. Consistency and patience work best!

q: Why is my cat meowing at night?
a: Hunger, attention, heat, or medical issues. Check basics first. If persistent, vet visit is essential. Establish nighttime routines.

q: What's the best way to introduce a puppy to a senior dog?
a: Go slowly, supervise constantly, use separate spaces initially. Let senior set pace. Reward calm, gentle interactions with treats!

q: How do I keep my pet's teeth clean?
a: Brush daily with pet toothpaste, provide dental treats/chews, and have annual vet cleanings. Clean teeth mean longer, healthier lives!

q: Can dogs be vegetarian?
a: Possible but challenging. Dogs need complete amino acids. Consult your vet before vegetarian diet. Meat-based food is usually optimal.

q: Why does my cat attack my hands during play?
a: Normal kitten/cat behavior! Use wand toys instead. Never use hands as toys. Direct attacks appropriately to maintain safety and bonds.

q: What's healthy treat frequency?
a: Treats should be 10% of daily calories maximum. Use healthy options like carrots or small training treats. Balance for weight management!

q: How do I help my dog with winter paws?
a: Use dog booties, paw balm, and rinse paws after walks to remove salt. Some breeds need winter gear. Keep nails trimmed!

q: Why does my cat knead?
a: Kneading shows contentment and comfort! It's leftover kitten behavior. Enjoy the affection and soft purring that usually accompanies it!

q: What's the best way to introduce cats to a new home?
a: Start in one room with food, water, and litter. Gradually expand access. Allow weeks for adjustment. Patience builds confidence!

q: How do I recognize food allergies in dogs?
a: Itching, ear infections, vomiting, or diarrhea indicate allergies. Work with vet on elimination diet. Common triggers: chicken, beef, wheat, soy.

q: Can cats see in color?
a: Cats see colors differently than humans. They see blues and greens well but reds look greenish. Their night vision is superior!

q: What's proper flea treatment timing?
a: Year-round prevention recommended. Monthly treatments for most products. Follow vet directions carefully. Prevention beats treatment always!

q: Why does my dog spin before lying down?
a: Ancient nesting instinct! Dogs circle to prepare comfortable resting spots. It's completely normal and harmless behavior.

q: How do I teach my cat to come?
a: Use high-value treats, call consistently, reward immediately. Start indoors in safe spaces. Patience and repetition build the behavior!

q: What's the best diet for a dog with sensitive stomach?
a: Limited ingredient, high-quality foods work best. Avoid fillers and artificial additives. Rice and chicken often work well. Ask your vet!

q: Why does my cat purr?
a: Contentment, comfort, self-healing, or hunger. Purring is multi-purpose! Your cat is communicating positive feelings with you.

q: How do I introduce my dog to children safely?
a: Always supervise interactions closely. Teach both dog and children proper boundaries. Reward calm, gentle behavior. Build positive associations!

q: What's normal cat vocalization?
a: Meows, chirps, purrs, and hisses are normal. Some breeds are more vocal. Changes in vocalization patterns warrant vet attention.

q: How do I stop destructive chewing?
a: Provide appropriate chew toys, supervise, redirect, and increase exercise. Bitter sprays deter unwanted chewing. Our toys satisfy this instinct safely!

q: Why is my cat's litter box large?
a: Larger boxes give cats more comfort and prevent overflow. Ideal size is 1.5x their body length. Provide multiple boxes for multi-cat homes!

q: How do I manage shedding during season changes?
a: Brush 2-3 times weekly, bathe monthly, use deshedding tools, and lint-roll frequently. Our grooming tools handle seasonal shedding beautifully!
